values:
I have had no replies to my latest entry in this journal. Have pthey all forgotten about me? Am I to be stuck here forever?

Ah, I am being impatient. I cannot lose my head now, not when I know my master is speaking with friends of his, powerful immortals, who will help him. 

Still, I long for even a simple 'hello'.
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/10062.html

It appears my sisters confinements are much different to mind. Lucifer does not make his presence known to me, as he does with them. Perhaps as I am not easily frightened, or because I am older. Or because this loneliness is far worse a punishment then neverending terror. 

I am no stranger to evil, but this is far beyond any torture even I could inflict. The ghostly apparitions walk the hallways, placid, faint expressions plastered on their transparent faces. I force myself not to run to them, to attempt to embrace the, for id I do, they go up in smoke, and I can hear faint cold laughter.

I cannot fly here, the ceilings are too low, and I cannot go outside. My wings ache from lack of use. 

I do nopt know how long I have been here. Hour melts into hour melts into hour. The clock on the wall has no hands. The blank face and dark numbers stare at me, mocking.

Oh I must escape this monotony, before I go mad.

Please, Vladislaus, Master, if you can read this...hurry.

-Verona
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/9744.html

Apparently, my Master is contacting an old friend of his Lucius, to help us escape.

This news fills me with joy and hope. Perhaps I shall escape here after all.
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/9575.html

Night does not come. Day does not come. Outside the windows, there is blank whiteness. Within the castle, nothing moves unless I touch it.

The most strange things are happening. I can see ghostly figures for a few seconds, pacing the halls of this place, before they dissapear.

Worse yet, they are ghost images of my sisters, and the count.

Luzifer taunts me. I must escape this place. I can only hope my Lord intends to rescue us.
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/9294.html

When will Luzifer decide I can be set free from this prison?

I hate the silence.

-Verona
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/8994.html

I have promised to continue the tales of my life...

I mourned my father for almost a year, but I eventually began to get on with my life. Around October, I was invited to a masqued ball, not far from my own home. 

I attended, glad to get away from my grief.

And, of course, I had barelled straight into the arms of the Count again. 

I accepted his invatation to stay with him at his palace for the week-end, but I ended up staying nearly a month. 

And then he told me he was a vampire. I panicked, fled, and did not see him for nearly half a year.

I finally came to terms with myself. I loved him, and I was not frightened of him, undead or not, and I returned to him.

And that, my dears, is simply it.
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/8839.html

My only solace is a journal. A cold, lifeless journal. 

And as I have promised, I suppose I shall tell you about my life.

I came to Transylvania with my father. He was a well-to-do scholar and had been called upon by the monks who had settled in the Carpathians to translate biblical texts from Romanian into French and Italian. 

He worked in an enormous library that has long since been demolished, and I was basically raised there. I read, as I had nothing else to do. No siblings, no mother, no friends and nowhere to go besides that huge, bustling library and our home. 

So I found company in books. Anything I could comprehend I read. 

And I met the count when I was merely nineteen.

About six years later did he begin to show any form of interest in me at all. 

That October was a cold one, and my father, used to the warm weather of our native Italy, died on the first day December. I mourned the death of not only my father but my only friend.

I stayed late beside his coffin (it was to be buried the following dawn) and saw the count. 

We spoke for many hours, until he melted away into the shadows, and the morning dawned within minutes of his departure.

I shall write more later. This silence is driving me mad...
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/8524.html

I pace endlessly. I do believe I may be wearing holes in the floor.

Things are very strange in this castly. It seems I am frozen in a moment in time. Nothing moves unless I touch it, and even then, the moment my fingertips leav its surface, it stops suddenly, quite still.

I miss my family more than I can possibly describe.

Aleera, as out of her mind as she may be. I miss her childish laughter and vivacity. Since she came out of her slump she has been a joy to me. 

Ands my beautiful, strong Marishka. I am unsure how long I have been here, but it seems like an eternity without her. Wild and carefree, always in a hurry, her golden hair streaming out behind her.

And my master. I cannot begin to tell you what torture it is without him.

I feel no bloodlust. I cannot leave this castle. 

I beg the devil to let me escape this place.

Perhaps I shall become so bored I shall tell the world the story of my life.
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/8273.html

I must get out of here...

I am going mad from worry.
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/7965.html

It is not normal that I find myself completely unnerved. But here I am, confused and concerned.

My sisters appear to be noweher. I personally haven't the faintest idea where I am, but that remains the least important of my worries.

I do believe the Devil has taken me from my life upon the earth. I remember this shadowy castle I am imprisoned in from the short period after my own death, and before I was reawakened. 

I call out to my sisters, to my dear Vladislaus, to the Devil. All that answers is ringing silence. 

And yet my study is in tact, and this journal available. Possibly as a cruel joke.

I shall keep my silence and my head until I can find out what exactly has happened to my sisters and to my husband.
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/7838.html

Most of my time, for the past weeks, has been deovted to pacing about the castle. 
I cannot leave, as is my Masters wish, so I cannot leave to occupy myself in the villiage.
Even though he is captive, I wish to obey his commands.
Both Aleera and Marishka have become surprisingly complacent (Aleera more than Marishka, I'm afraid).
I feel like I'm to explode. 
Gabriel is being incredibly secretive about the affairs of The Torche.
We hope our Master will be back with us shortly.
For now, I will retire.
-Verona
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/7459.html

My master grows weaker. And hungrier. I can feel it within me.
But I shall follow my instructions: Take care of the girls, and remain strong.
Normally I derive my strength from my masters presence.
I beg the devil to help Gabriel bring him safely home. 
I must hunt. It is too quiet here. The screams of a mortal and the sweet blood should take my mind off him...at least for the time being. 
-Verona
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/7193.html

My sisters and I are frightened. Frightened for our master, for Gabriel, for (sadly) ourselves. The Torche knows about us, they can kill my dear Vladislaus! I am so distraught. Marishka and Aleera are beyond comfort. 
-Verona
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/7109.html

You may ask why I have not written for so very long. I have good reason. Vladislaus went missing a few days after the previous entry in my dear diary. He went out to hunt, and never returned. My sisters and I were terribly distressed. Normally, we would have recieved a telepathic message from him, telling us he was alright, but nothing came. Aleera became chalk white and horribly depressed, Marishka lost most of her wildness, and I found myself sobbing quietly. Then, we receaved a letter from the masked Torche members. We were to surrender ourselves, in exchange for his life. Marishka was the first to agree, then myself, and finally Aleera. The poor dear. She is nothing without our master. I can feel the count's weakness within me, and it hurts, beyond anything my immortality can heal. They come for us tomorrow night...
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/6672.html

Today, I was delighted when my Master suggested we go out to town to purchase the comb I had been lusting after for quite some time. Which is a good thing, because Marishka had been plotting to sneak out wit me to go buy it ourselves. But we'd never work up the courage. Me, anyway. She is so wild, and carefree. I envy her sometimes. 

We located the little shop, and bought the comb. So beautiful...its emeralds sparkled in the silvery moonlight. He twisted my hair up skillfully (I would have wondered how he knew to do this, but after hundreds of years, one picks such things up) and placed the comb into it. His fingers lingered at the base of my neck for a moment. *sigh*. It has been countless decades, and he still sends shivers down my spine.
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/6430.html

My hair is now back to the length it was before I was...set on fire, by The Torche. Of course, I thought, this called for some form of silent celebration, and I longed to go and purchase a comb to put it up with, but I am not to leave, so I shant. There was the most entranciing one in a jewlers not too far from the mansion. Silver, studded with emeralds. But I shall resist, and obey my master.
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/6365.html

Joy, beyond all unimaginable joy. My master returned to us unharmed. 

I did away with "ladylike" and pretty much attacked him when he appeared. Dusty and disgruntled? I cared not. Even Aleera threw herself down the stairs when he appeared.

*purrs* Again, I won't go into the details of the night. 

I do believe our dear Vladislaus will be nursing a sore neck, though. *laughs*
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/5938.html

Again, I fret for my Master.

He sent us mental messages, assuring us he was safe, but nonetheless...

Apparently, he was having a little 'chat' with the werewolf's human form, when a large wave of water swept him away. The werewolf drowned.

Which is a pity, because he knew much of The Torch. 

Marishka and myself wait by the door. I have my arm around her. Although she is still in her room, Aleera smells of fear and worry as well. The poor girl

When he returns, I really must resist the urge to leap on him. It is not ladylike or dignified.

-Verona
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/5745.html

Oh dear...now a werewolf lurks in Budapest. This one seems much more intellegent then the usual sort, my master could not penetrate its mind. More to come...
-Verona
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/5477.html

I write this in the wonderful si,ence of the castle. Marishka and my dear count have left to hunt again. The second time in two days. I understand completely though. She was deprived of nourishment, and he was deprived of his Marishka. 

Alexander was quite charming. Elegant and refined, he pleased the four of us with his presence. Aleera smiled, the dear girl. I hope she is coming back out of her shadowy rooms and back to us. We miss her. 

Marishka looked quite fine in her gown, as did Aleera. Her eyes sparkled, and she seemed rejuvenated for the first time as we hunted together, myself, my sisters, Alexander, and my master. 

I am refreshed and full. The sun replaces the moon, and I must away.

-Verona
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/5271.html

Alexander will be visiting with us tonight.

I have decided on an emerald satin dress, and I shall fix my hair up. It has grown long enough to work with.

Ah...I ramble on about dresses and hair. 

But that is what this journal is for. She I nshall bid thee farewell, and continue with preperations.

-Verona
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/4916.html

My poor Marishka. Apparently she was wandering about the town house (we are forbidden to leave) when she found herself caught in open sunlight. Some idiot servant had forgotten to close the shades. Vladislaus immediatley assembled the staff and sniff out the culprit. A young girl. She was fired on the spot. The my Master left to hunt. I fear for him every time he leaves. 
-Verona
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/4612.html

The opera was fabulous. 

Yet Aleera remained straightfaced throughout the entire thing. Her eyes were red-rimmed, which surprised me. The girl hasn't cried in well over 70 years now. 

The count was much more relaxed, which made for a rther pleasant evening. 

And it took my mind off of 'The Torch'. I really must speak with my dear red-headed sister. Something is not right. 

(ooc: I'm not sure if I shoudl write something or not about my chat with Leery. Would xx_aleera_xx be mad? I dunno...)
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/4387.html

I'm scared.
Yes. I've said it. I'm scared. The Alliance, the Torch, or whatever they call themselves, has taken one of the staff members, or is the rumor I have heard. 
I don't want to be hurt again.
What if they go for Marishka? What if they kill her?
I tried to forget it, and Marishka, Aleera (though  she was strangely quiet) and I went out, I was shaky and jumped at the slightest sound. 
The count is researching. 
All I want is to run to him and ask him to make it better. Like a two year old mortal! Is this what I've become? 
Sobbing over my hair and now this. I feel like such a...oh, adjectives can't describe how helpless I feel. 
I hover aimlessly outside the library door. About to walk in and fulfill the stupid actions said above, then the stronger half of me makes me stop. 
Im so confused. 
I will write more when things happen. 
Sorry for my absence...
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/4345.html

Ack. I'm afraid I wont be able to post until sometime this weekend.
SORRY!
-Verona/Fangy
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/3886.html

No, not trouble with my dear sister. But she's been acting a little strange. Retiring to her room for rather long periods of time. Normally she's busy tossing herself at my master. But not today. She has managed to throw a couple of icy glares in my direction, while my dear Marishka seems very forgiving, and is planning shopping trips etc. 

She is such a dear friend, and sister.
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/3795.html

Things went very smoothly as soon as the girls came home. 
I must say both me and my master were affected. In a good way, mind you.
I wont go into details of the night *laugh*.

I am very happy. Very happy indeed. I apologized for being short-tempered with the two of them, and they promised to be more...controlled in the future.

And my beloved count is doing much reasearch on the hidden orginization.

-Verona
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/3369.html

Ah, joy.
My sisters return to me today. 
I could sing.
But it wouldnt be exactly proper, so I wont.
The first think they noticed was my hair. Ah, someone who understood what it was like. I feel so much better. and Vladislaus is in much better spirits. They have that affect on him, when they are calmer, and act slightly more their positions. 
I feel just like a girl...
-Verona
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/3273.html

My master has agreed to allow Marishka and Aleera to return home. I am overjoyed, though Aleera might still be mad at me. I don't really know, and I don't really care. When they are...calmer, they make good companions. 

Also, they will truly understand about my hair. 

And my dress.

Oh dear, now I feel rather obnoxious. But, where a better place to complain than a diary. All the things that cannot be said are out down here.

But then again, I do have that sneaking suspicion that Aleera reads this, so I wont divulge in any other childish whining.
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/2908.html

Things have been very lonely for the past few days. I found no point in writing, but people DO read, and therefore I shall keep on with my daily life.

The castle is so large and empty. The count makes an effort to pay attention, he really does, but it isnt the same. Bitchy banshees they may be, but I miss Aleera and Marishka.

I do hope that Charlotte isn't too hard on them. It has been a while since they were sent away. I must try to convince the count to allow them back. There is nothing like a female companion to cry with you over the loss of hair.

But on the brighter side, my hair does grow faster than any mortals. Already a few inches have been added to my locks.
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/2595.html

Though my back and arms are much healed, I must say what upsets me the most is my hair.
Over a foot worth of it was gone, and the ends black and charred. I found a barber to cut the burnt parts off, so now I have a rather short bob. My hair does not live, therefore I cannot grow it back. 
We have found out who it was, that managed to set fire to me. Radai, a wealthy gentleman from Budapest. I still have no clue why it was done, things are kept from me.

I do dearly hope that Aleera and Marishka will return soon. The count is very vague and quiet, always plotting something, though he is obviously trying to make an effort to pay more attention to me, since the 'incident'.

I feel so helpless. 

-Verona
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/2378.html

The night began as well as it could have.
There were many distinguished guests, faces I recognized, and those I didn't. 
And I wore the gown I had bought several days before. 
I sat beside my master, and, as I said above, things went very well. 
About halfway through the meal (we did not participate in the eating, for obvious reasons), Vladislaus was called into the entrance hall. My ears picked up an acute disturbance, an argument, perhaps? 
This wernt on for several moments, then my back and arms started to feel distinctly hot, then I smelt burning hair.
It was mine.
Suddenly, my dress went up in flame, the beautiful wine-colored satin charring, and my skin blistered. It is an odd feeling, being burned and healing at the same time, but it was too insense. 
And someone behind me spoke, but I could not discern the words. I could see Van Helsing and My master framed in the doorway.
I shall write more tommorow, as soo as I sort out my thoughts.
-Verona
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/2102.html

This post is entirely out of character: When I recieve word (or basically, a post from vladislaus), I shall post about the reception. I do not know the exact date it is happening, or has happened. So for now, I shall be absent.
-Verona/Fangy
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/1967.html

Another day to spend at my leisure. I know when those two return, there will be hell to pay, but for now I revel in my freedom. And my master's reception is drawing nearer. I am dreadfully sorry for the shortness of my posting, but nothing much is happening. Mind you, that is a good think.
-Verona
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/1671.html

Finally, a day of peace and quiet. Why, you ask? Because Aleera and Marishka are gone from the palace. They are under the watchful eye of a close friend, Charlotte, who the count apparently employed after my call. The dwergi are terrified, and leap to do my bidding, and all is well. 
I am to be the only bride at the reception as well. The girs's behaivor did not go over to well with the count. That did NOT make them too happy. 
I feel like the weight of the world is off my shoulders. 
-Verona
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/1375.html

Again, more trouble with Aleera. It appeared, without the presence of the count, my instructions meant little. A few hours after my post yesterday, they disappeared, without any notice, to me, or the staff. They were gone all throughout the day and the night, and finally returned not two minutes ago. Both had human alcahol on their breath. 'A little fun' they called it. I sent them to their respective rooms and posted a guard there to watch them. I was in tears with the relief of their homecoming for, even though they are terribly childish, annoying, and bratty, they are much like sisters to me. Then the screaming came. Aleera had tried to escape the confines of her room. Probably to come and kill me. She has such a temper! I raced up to my tower, and phoned the count. And, to my utmost happiness, he had conceded to come! I will NOT tell them. He shall see for himself their behavior. Aleera has already shredded the beautiful tapestry in her bedroom in her petty attempts to get back at me. 

In other news, the Count is holding a reception at the Palace. I had to tell them to prepare, and nearly lost an arm in doing so. Both are most upset with me...but at least they had a use for the dressed they had bought. 
-Verona
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/1162.html

I asked myself yesterday "What does the count see in them?"
I have the answer. For Aleera anyway. She's insane. 
We hunted yesterday, and she bagan to laugh maniacally and kill everything in her path. The entire town was in an uproar. I have no idea what has gotten into the girl...

But the subject of this entry is Dwergi. Vile, disgusting creatures! I have taken quite a liking to one small study, up, in the talles spire of the palace. I came there today, to write, and what has happened to it? My lords little sadistic oompah-loompahs had turned it into an eatery! Books and papers scattered everywhere, and they had a fire built there, and were roasting some form of animal over it, jabbering away in their wierd language. I screamed at them to get out, and they did, but everything is ruined. THEY BURNED MY BOOKS FOR THEIR FIRE! Now the entire room smells of burnt sheep...

I have said that Vladislaus should pick more...elegant assistants, but he insists upon these horrid hairy midgets! My only consolation is this journal, as my master is not here.
-Verona
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/853.html

Finally, we have recieved word that perhaps my master will join us at the Summer Palace, but for now he has buisness to attend to. But that has made both Aleera and Marishka exicted and wild. And now, I have the most exquisite headache. I retire to one of the many studies of the palace to write this. 
I have a sneaking suspicion one of my fellow brides is reading this. But I will spill my stories of today anyway, let them be mad at me. See what I care.
A messenger arrived with the news you see above. I attempted to recieve the message without the knowledge of Aleera and Marishka, but they barreled down the steps to listen. When he told us, they broke into annoying-high pitched shrieks and idiotic little dances of joy. Duty called, so I concealed my joy. As I said yesterday, they act like such children. What the count sees in them, I can't imagine. Although they have absolutely no idea when he comes, they run about, making reperations. I can't stand it! So here I am. And my head throbs, so I must depart.
-Verona
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/675.html

Ah. I must say it is my nature as a female, though several hundred years old, to enjoy buying clothing. We took a trip to the summer palace in Budapest, as the frigid Castle Dracula became boring for the three of us, and, to my eternal shame, we complained endlessly until my master let us leave. Upon our arrival Marishka suggested scouting the local stores. I had more fun than expected. Normally I let Aleera and Marishka do what they will, flirt with mortal men and buy extravagant items of apparel, but they made me join them. I managed to find a suitable tailor who produced the most fabulous dresses. We purchased several items of evening-wear and everyday dresses. I do dearly hope the count joins us. He seems very lonely these days. I believe a trip out to Budapest would do him good. The girls have been begging for another masquerade ball as well. Sometimes they act like such children.
http://xveronax.livejournal.com/332.html
